01-getting-started Overview 0.1 Course Aims 0.2 Intended Learning Outcomes

01-getting-started Ines Patop 2020-03-29 Overview This book contains some usefull resources for Genomic Analysis in R. 0.1 Course Aims Learn basic coding intuition and usage of R for analysis and plots. Undestand the main issues we have to deal with in Genomics. Learn how to do basic analysis, Chipseq, RNAseq, SingleCell. 0.2 Intended Learning Outcomes By the end of this course students will be able to: Create your own R code. Do basic and complex analysis. Read and understand code.

Lab 1 R Markdown This is an R Markdown document. Markdown is a simple formatting syntax for authoring HTML, PDF, and MS Word documents. For more details on using R Markdown see http://rmarkdown.rstudio.com. When you click the Knit button a document will be generated that includes both content as well as the output of any embedded R code chunks within the document. You can embed an R code chunk like this: summary(cars) ## speed dist ## Min. : 4.0 Min. : 2.00 ## 1st Qu.:12.0 1st Qu.: 26.00 ## Median :15.0 Median : 36.00 ## Mean :15.4 Mean : 42.98 ## 3rd Qu.:19.0 3rd Qu.: 56.00 ## Max. :25.0 Max. :120.00 1.1 Including Plots You can also embed plots, for example: Figure 1.1: CAPTION THIS FIGURE!! Note that the echo = FALSE parameter was added to the code chunk to prevent printing of the R code that generated the plot.
